verses.kjv: Rebuke not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger men as brethren;
verses.ct: Don't speak harshly to an older man. Instead, appeal to him as you would a father. Treat younger men as brothers,

verses.kjv: The elder women as mothers; the younger as sisters, with all purity.
verses.ct: older women as mothers, and younger women as sisters, with complete purity.

verses.kjv: Honour widows that are widows indeed.
verses.ct: Give proper support to widows who are truly on their own.

verses.kjv: But if any widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to shew piety at home, and to requite their parents: for that is good and acceptable before God.
verses.ct: But if a widow has children or grandchildren, those family members should first learn to show their devotion to God by caring for their own household and repaying their parents for raising them — this is good and pleasing to God.

verses.kjv: Now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in God, and continueth in supplications and prayers night and day.
verses.ct: A widow who is truly alone and without support has placed her hope in God and devotes herself to prayer and petitions day and night.

verses.kjv: But she that liveth in pleasure is dead while she liveth.
verses.ct: But a widow who lives for self-indulgence is spiritually dead even while she's alive.

verses.kjv: And these things give in charge, that they may be blameless.
verses.ct: Instruct everyone about these things so that no one can be blamed.

verses.kjv: But if any provide not for his own, and specially for those of his own house, he hath denied the faith, and is worse than an infidel.
verses.ct: If anyone fails to provide for their own relatives, and especially for their immediate family, that person has rejected the faith and is worse than an unbeliever.

verses.kjv: Let not a widow be taken into the number under threescore years old, having been the wife of one man,
verses.ct: A widow should not be added to the official list unless she is at least 60 years old and was faithful to her husband.

verses.kjv: Well reported of for good works; if she have brought up children, if she have lodged strangers, if she have washed the saints’ feet, if she have relieved the afflicted, if she have diligently followed every good work.
verses.ct: She must be known for doing good — whether she raised children, showed hospitality to strangers, served God's people in humble ways, helped those in distress, or devoted herself to every kind of good work.

verses.kjv: But the younger widows refuse: for when they have begun to wax wanton against Christ, they will marry;
verses.ct: But turn down younger widows for the list, because when their desires pull them away from their commitment to Christ, they want to remarry,

verses.kjv: Having damnation, because they have cast off their first faith.
verses.ct: and they bring judgment on themselves for breaking their original pledge.

verses.kjv: And withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house; and not only idle, but tattlers also and busybodies, speaking things which they ought not.
verses.ct: On top of that, they develop a habit of being idle, going from house to house — and not just idle, but also gossips and meddlers, talking about things they shouldn't.

verses.kjv: I will therefore that the younger women marry, bear children, guide the house, give none occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully.
verses.ct: So my advice is that younger widows get married, have children, and manage their homes, giving the enemy no opportunity to criticize us.

verses.kjv: For some are already turned aside after Satan.
verses.ct: Some have already wandered off to follow Satan.

verses.kjv: If any man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve them, and let not the church be charged; that it may relieve them that are widows indeed.
verses.ct: If any believing man or woman has widows in their family, they should take care of them and not put the burden on the church, so the church can help those widows who are truly on their own.

verses.kjv: Let the elders that rule well be counted worthy of double honour, especially they who labour in the word and doctrine.
verses.ct: Elders who lead effectively deserve double recognition, especially those who work hard at preaching and teaching.

verses.kjv: For the scripture saith, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that treadeth out the corn. And, The labourer is worthy of his reward.
verses.ct: For Scripture says, 'Don't muzzle an ox while it's threshing grain,' and also, 'A worker deserves to be paid.'

verses.kjv: Against an elder receive not an accusation, but before two or three witnesses.
verses.ct: Don't accept an accusation against an elder unless it's supported by 2 or 3 witnesses.

verses.kjv: Them that sin rebuke before all, that others also may fear.
verses.ct: Those who persist in sin should be corrected publicly, so that everyone else will take it seriously.

verses.kjv: I charge thee before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, and the elect angels, that thou observe these things without preferring one before another, doing nothing by partiality.
verses.ct: I urge you — in the presence of God, the Lord Jesus Christ, and the chosen angels — to follow these instructions without prejudging anyone or showing favoritism.

verses.kjv: Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men’s sins: keep thyself pure.
verses.ct: Don't be too quick to lay hands on anyone to appoint them, and don't get involved in other people's sins. Keep yourself pure.

verses.kjv: Drink no longer water, but use a little wine for thy stomach’s sake and thine often infirmities.
verses.ct: Stop drinking only water — use a little wine for the sake of your stomach and your frequent illnesses.

verses.kjv: Some men’s sins are open beforehand, going before to judgment; and some men they follow after.
verses.ct: The sins of some people are obvious and lead them straight to judgment, while for others, their sins only come to light later.

verses.kjv: Likewise also the good works of some are manifest beforehand; and they that are otherwise cannot be hid.
verses.ct: In the same way, good works are sometimes clearly visible right away, and even when they aren't, they can't stay hidden forever.
